newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha ends firm with crude, dogged by freigh.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha ends firm with crude, dogged by freigh.

text.p: NWE naphtha prices ended slightly higher on Thursday but the market was still dogged by high freight rates in the north and the Med.
"The problem again is about the freight rates," said one source.
The cost of shipping a cargo from Skikda to Northwest Europe is roughly high quotes +$10, but the market is only fetching high +$2, he said.
Material, therefore, will likely move into an end-user's system or a trader will sit on it and hope for a change in the market.
End-user demand appeared to be picking up in the Med but the high freight rates has had the effect of making that market even tighter, the source said.
Feb swaps ended $3 higher at $221/$222 a tonne and March rose the same amount to $215.50/$216.50, pulling back from their highs when crude edged lower.
Earlier, Stichting Euroilstock said in its monthly report that naphtha production in the European Union, excluding Sweden, rose 26,000 barrels per day in December, or 2.7 percent, to 994,000 bpd.
That is 110,000 bpd or 12.6 pct higher than in December 1995.
